poem.content:
A brass sun bleeds into the bay,
another margin thinning, day by day.
Welcome, the panther whispers, sleek and low,
to the concrete jungle where anxieties grow.

I play the game, each coin a loaded dice,
the news a constant, humming, hollow vice.
To improve the odds, a frantic, fevered plea,
but still, the sadness clings so close to me.

The panther watches with indifferent eyes,
as hope's frail ember flickers, then it dies.
A brassy taste, a bitter residue,
the ocean sighs, it knows what's true.

Welcome, again, to the echoing despair,
a web of shadows, tangling in your hair.
Margin calls and broken promises gleam,
a waking nightmare, a forgotten dream.

Improve yourself, the phantom voices cry,
but panic rises, blotting out the sky.
The panther purrs, "Embrace the coming gloom,"
another brass-tinged sunset seals your doom.
